ArticleProfile.title: Xanthomonas polysaccharides — Improved methods for their comparison
ArticleProfile.abstract: Abstract The extracellular polysaccharides from a number of Xanthomonas strains, together with preparations from strains grown under different conditions, have been examined by conventional biochemical methods. The carbohydrate composition showed little variation — d -glucose, d -mannose and d -glucuronic acid being present in the approximate molar ratio 2:2:1 — but considerable differences were noted in the acetyl and pyruvyl contents. Two different enzyme preparations have been used to digest the polysaccharides and the resultant products have been examined. Determination of the ratio of certain fragments from enzyme degradation under standard conditions provides an accurate indication of the proportion of pyruvylated to non-pyruvylated side-chains and may also indicate the presence of side-chains lacking glucuronic acid.
